channel.title: AI-Pulse - Stock Market & Finance
channel.description: Stock Market & Finance news from AI-Pulse

item.title: Global stocks slip with earnings and US-Iran tensions in focus
item.description: Global stocks slip with earnings and US-Iran tensions in focus

item.title: While Wall Street is betting against software, retail investors have poured in — and done well
item.description: Retail investors have been a mighty force to start 2026 and they’ve not shying away from battered software stocks.

item.title: As OpenClaw’s popularity has surged, so too has this computer-maker’s stock
item.description: The advent of a popular open-source project that lets users create personal AI agents is lifting shares of the company making hobbyist computers.

item.title: Walmart’s stock falls as the outlook for future profits wasn’t good enough
item.description: Walmart’s stock drops after quarterly revenue from its U.S. stores and the outlook for profits this year were below Wall Street’s projections.

item.title: Global oil benchmark hits 6-month high amid fears of U.S.-Iran conflict
item.description: Brent crude futures, the global oil benchmark, on Thursday rose above $71 a barrel for the first time since late July, amid fears supplies could be compromised by a U.S. attack on Iran.

item.title: Palantir’s stock has dropped a third from its peak. Michael Burry has a new line of attack.
item.description: Michael Burry, the former hedge-fund manager chronicled in “The Big Short” for his bets against the housing market during the subprime-mortgage crisis, went through Palantir’s 10-K.

item.title: Airbus can’t get enough engines. The stock is falling.
item.description: Plane maker Airbus on Thursday said it’s having trouble sourcing enough engines as it outlined guidance that disappointed investors.
